posts.cooked:
So I am trying to run some code to test if Autonomous commands can be run when an Apriltag. I have an if statement of if it detects ID 7 it drives forward, otherwise if ID 8 is detected, it runs a turning command, if neither are true it does not run. Or at least, that is what is supposed to happen, instead after seeing ID 7 it only runs the drive forward command.

posts.cooked: I am confused on what you mean by that. I checked with trying to see if I could find a Conditional Command, but there seems to be no reference I can find in my code to Commands.conditional.

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked: Commands.conditional in the commands library implements exactly what you’re after (if a particular condition is true, run this command, otherwise run a different command). Don’t attempt to implement the switching yourself.
Ok, so how would I import that?

posts.cooked:
declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command, class: ConditionalCommand

Individual commands are capable of accomplishing a large variety of robot tasks, but the simple three-state format can quickly become cumbersome when more advanced functionality requiring extended ...

Yeah so the Limelight I was testing code on was moved over to my team’s robot for the competition, so now I have to try and do the programming for a Swerve robot if I want to continue with trying to make a conditional command, otherwise I can continue trying out the conditional command on the chassis using a variable instead

Looking through the Commands file in the WPILib API. It seems like the closest one to a conditional command is

select ​( Map <K,​ Command > commands, Supplier <? extends K> selector)

Currently, I am trying to make it so I can use a value that can be changed in shuffleboard that works with an if statement to run a specific command, but I cannot seem to run anything, I imported networktables, shuffleboard, ConditionalCommand, and Commands. I can’t seem to figure it out.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: Commands.either(null, null, null); or import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands.either; either(null, null, null);
I seemingly figured out a solution, I just can’t seem to publish my results to Github

Alright: The code is now available on Github, there is still a bit I need to do before getting Autonomous based on a condition, but I am almost there, the code is available at: GitHub - SmartKirb99/Other-Chassis-Bot

The code that I found that works is in the RobotContainer file and the TestDualCommand file

It seems that the reason my code that works when a button is pressed doesn’t work when in the if statement might be because I am running that inside a command.

I tried adding SelectCommand to my Robot Container, threw an error, tried the either command, threw an error. I don’t know what else to try.

What error? The double composition one? (There’s a bug this year and it appears as Originally composed at: <stacktrace> ) If it’s double composition, it means you’re reusing commands in multiple compositions – which doesn’t work. Create a new instance for each composition: factory methods can help do that in a concise way.

By the way, your TestDualCommand doesn’t work because you’re creating a command but not scheduling it – and that logic shouldn’t be done in a command anyway. It should be done using either / select – though note that they check the condition when they’re scheduled.

If you need to constantly switch, it’d be better to build the logic using Trigger s (which can express any boolean condition and be composed with and , or , and not ) rather than in commands.

posts.name: Ned FInkle
posts.cooked: Use a conditional command like others said, but also know that unless you are using a deferred command your logic will be handled at compilation and not autoInit.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: So, I am trying to do something similar, taking in input from the driverstation and changing the commands in the auton sequence depending on the input. Would something like this work? temporaryrepo3984/Crescendo-WorkingAuto-03_04_2024/src/main/java/frc/robot/RobotContainer.java at main · DesteoyerRZSS/temporaryrepo3984 · GitHub or would I have to change it to the conditional commands format.
No? ConditionalCommand and SelectCommand select the command to run when they’re scheduled. Only the options are determined at startup.
Assuming getAutoCommand is called in autoInit, that’s when the logic will run, therefore it should work as expected – cool code!
